com.noctarius.tengi.spi.serialization

Interface Serializer


  • public interface Serializer
    The Serializer interface is the entry point into any serialization process. It provides functionality to directly read or write objects as well as offering access to Encoders and Decoders, both in an auto-closable fashion.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Serializer create(Collection<MarshallerConfiguration> marshallerConfigurations)
      Creates a new Serializer instance with the default Protocol implementation and binds the given MarshallerConfigurations collection.
      static Serializer create(Protocol protocol)
      Creates a new Serializer instance with the given Protocol implementation.
      Protocol getProtocol()
      Returns the bound Protocol implementation.
      <O> O readObject(String fieldName, Decoder decoder)
      Reads the content of a non-null object from the underlying byte-stream buffer.
      AutoClosableDecoder retrieveDecoder(MemoryBuffer memoryBuffer)
      Returns an AutoClosableDecoder instance bound to the underlying protocol and the given MemoryBuffer.

      Returns an AutoClosableEncoder instance bound to the underlying protocol and the given MemoryBuffer.

      Transfers a non-null object to a new MemoryBuffer and returns this buffer instance.
      <O> void writeObject(String fieldName, O object, Encoder encoder)
      Transfers a non-null object to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • getProtocol

        Protocol getProtocol()
        Returns the bound Protocol implementation.
        Returns:
        the underlying Protocol

      • readObject

        <O> O readObject(String fieldName,
                 Decoder decoder)
          throws Exception

        Reads the content of a non-null object from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The content itself will be deserialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to read a type tag for the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might have decided to write the value to the stream but this is not required.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to be read, strictly for debugging purpose only
        decoder - the Decoder to read the object from
        Returns:
        the non-null object value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • writeObject

        <O> MemoryBuffer writeObject(String fieldName,
                             O object)
                      throws Exception

        Transfers a non-null object to a new MemoryBuffer and returns this buffer instance. The content itself will be serialized using a registered Marshaller ir as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to tag the type of the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might decide to write the value to the stream but is not required to.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Parameters:
        object - the object value to be written to the buffer
        fieldName - the name of the field to be written, strictly for debugging purpose only
        Returns:
        the MemoryBuffer instance that contains the objects content
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements
        NullPointerException - whenever the given object is null
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • writeObject

        <O> void writeObject(String fieldName,
                     O object,
                     Encoder encoder)
              throws Exception

        Transfers a non-null object to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The content itself will be serialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to tag the type of the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might decide to write the value to the stream but is not required to.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Parameters:
        object - the object value to be written to the buffer
        fieldName - the name of the field to be written, strictly for debugging purpose only
        encoder - the Encoder to write the object to
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements
        NullPointerException - whenever the given object is null
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • retrieveEncoder

        AutoClosableEncoder retrieveEncoder(MemoryBuffer memoryBuffer)
        Returns an AutoClosableEncoder instance bound to the underlying protocol and the given MemoryBuffer.
        Parameters:
        memoryBuffer - the MemoryBuffer to bind
        Returns:
        the auto-closable Encoder instance

      • retrieveDecoder

        AutoClosableDecoder retrieveDecoder(MemoryBuffer memoryBuffer)
        Returns an AutoClosableDecoder instance bound to the underlying protocol and the given MemoryBuffer.
        Parameters:
        memoryBuffer - the MemoryBuffer to bind
        Returns:
        the auto-closable Decoder instance

      • create

        static Serializer create(Collection<MarshallerConfiguration> marshallerConfigurations)
        Creates a new Serializer instance with the default Protocol implementation and binds the given MarshallerConfigurations collection.
        Parameters:
        marshallerConfigurations - the MarshallerConfiguration collection to bind
        Returns:
        the Serializer instance with bound Marshallers

      • create

        static Serializer create(Protocol protocol)
        Creates a new Serializer instance with the given Protocol implementation.
        Parameters:
        protocol - the Protocol instance to bind
        Returns:
        the Serializer instance bound to the given Protocol
